title: "Kha'Zix why are you building full damage?"
body:
"You're not supposed to build damage as jungle" "You're supposed to get a sightstone for vision control" (and yes, I was buying wards) "You're not supposed to get kills you're supposed to just snowball the lanes"

Yep, Riot has officially pushed people into the mindset that the jungle is just the second support.

Also, really, who the hell isn't building nearly full damage on {{champion:121}}? He's an assassin not a tank...

> [{quoted}](name=Gavran,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=QyWX9zXw,comment-id=00030001,timestamp=2015-03-18T10:06:20.200+0000)

Saying this as someone who plays support primarily:

When you play support you are likely picking a champion who is designed to be effective without significant amounts of damage/items. It makes sense to build Sighstone and non-damage items on support because you are meant to offer utility and will never carry as hard as a mid laner. Most junglers are not built to be effective without their items, so rushing Mikael's on a Master Yi just isn't going to work out.

Play Janna and most of what you offer with your abilities is completely unaffected by what you build. A knockup is a knockup regardless of how much AP is behind it. Play an assassin jungler and don't build damage and you have for no reason decided to make yourself useless.

I mean have you ever told your ADC or APC to build support? It's just not a good thing to do. It's not a case of "lol the support is the bitch everyone screws over", it's a case of "I do not want my carries to build support because I want to win and they have better things to offer".

I play both Janna and Lulu, and my build contains almost no damage, and just a little bit of health. Pretty much just my support item, crucible, boots, and tons of vision.

I'm in it for the utility, I don't need my abilities to scale.

I wouldn't force a support to buy sightstone anyway. It's a cost effective item for a role designated to have the lowest gold income (it sucks, I know), but I don't care as long as *everyone* is buying wards. You either buy a sightstone or buy wards. And that goes for everyone.

At this rate we're going to see ADC's demanding everyone else buys a Sightstone or they're feeding.  And if they get banned, the community will yell at Rito until said players are unbanned.  Because, that's the ***Most*** important and only set in stone role.

Here's a secret that many people don't do:

In ranked games, I prefer playing the ADC (not my favorite role, but...) and... warding. I focus on cs, not kills, during the laning phase then buy wards along with my core build. 

And sometimes, my support just buys wards with me and builds other items (like Lux building AP, and so on).

And it never impedes my build. That's the secret. The adc can buy wards and stay in the game.

Supports f—ing love it when they don't have to be the only one warding.

Indeed.  I buy wards on every back (sometimes two or three on a single back if I didn't upgrade my trinket), but nine times out of ten, the ward amount ends up being 70% Support, 25% me, and the other three players fitting into the last five percent with unupgraded trinket wards.  I only see upgraded trinkets from the rare intelligent player, or when everyone has full build.  I've even come across people at full build who deliberately avoid upgrading the trinket to piss everyone else on his team off.

While I'm not shocked that people have connected that the jungler is everywhere, he should also carry a Sightstone (possibly stemming from how sometimes you get a tank jungler or Lee Sin carrying one in their builds), I'm a little shocked about how long it took to go from Support only and everyone flames you for doing it too, to the jungler gets demanded he too carry a Sightstone.

As for my ADC comment, the only role that is literally one champion type (and even limited within that type) is the duo lane carry, aka ADC, and of bottom lane.  Every other role, meta, and tactic can pretty much be anything.  But that team member is different.  It's the only one that has never changed for fifty-seven months (since mid summer 2011).  I've even seen Marksmen as Supports, but I have never seen any other meta where the carry wasn't a Marksman (even during the double bruiser kill meta, Marksman+Support was still a pretty dominant strategy).  Nowhere in the history of League has a real Marksman recommended to purchase a Sightstone.  By anyone.  Even if ahead, it's the only role where the community vehemently doesn't like a Sightstone in your build.  Everyone else could build six Ruby Sighstones for all they care, but if you even think about building one and people find out, you're getting nine reports (or more).  ***It's something I never understood***.

Gonna be honest, I keep hearing the same damn excuse from Bronze players when they play adc:

"I don't have to buy wards, I'm the adc."

A sightstone is a big safeguard from that.
I'm still experimenting with when to build sightstone in the jungle, but I agree that it is situational. Don't criticize people's builds, unless its like AP Zed...

As an aside from my wall of text I'd also like to say that I'm definitely on board with this too. If someone asks for help (like me whenever I have to ADC. I am such a shitty ADC please tell me what to build when I ask if you know.), then by all means tell them and tell them where they went wrong, but otherwise unless they're just building something completely asinine (AP Zed, a second Ruunan's Hurricane, Mejai's when they're 2/11/5) the most you should ever offer unsolicited is "Have you tried building X on Y? I like it."
